page.title: 05FREEDOM SURFBOARD FACTORY
page.content: The Freedom Surfboard factory at Coin Varin is the biggest and one of the best in Europe. Paul Russell, one of the best surfers in the UK, uses Freedom surfboards and so do the French team. The first stage in the making of a surfboard is the making of the foam blank. This is done by pouring polyurethene in liquid form into a concrete mould which is the shape of a fat surfboard to give room to be shaped. Next the board is hand-shaped with an electric plane. The blank is then laminated with polyester resin and glass cloth and the fin is attached. A filler coat of resin is then applied to each side. The board is then sanded all over. A gloss coat of thinned resin is applied to each side and finally the board is rubbed down with wet/dry sandpaper and polished.
